intro: Adinandra glischroloma var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy adinandra, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
